recipe_card: Blueberry Dessert 4 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"½ cup softened butter"},{"recipe_ingredients":"26  saltine crackers, crushed"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ cup chopped walnuts"},{"recipe_ingredients":"4  large egg whites"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup white sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon cream of tartar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon white vinegar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon vanilla extract"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 (21 ounce) can blueberry pie filling"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon lemon juice"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup heavy cream"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon vanilla extract"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons confectioners' sugar"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Preheat an oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)."},{"recipe_directions":"Mix the butter, crushed saltines, and walnuts together in a bowl, and press the mixture into the bottom of an 8x12 inch baking dish."},{"recipe_directions":"With an electric mixer, beat the egg whites, sugar, cream of tartar, and vinegar in a large metal or glass bowl until the mixture forms stiff peaks, then beat in 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract. Spread the meringue mixture over the prepared crust, and bake in the preheated oven until the meringue is golden brown and firm, 10 to 15 minutes. Let the crust cool."},{"recipe_directions":"Mix together the blueberry pie filling and lemon juice in a bowl, and spread the mixture over the cooled meringue."},{"recipe_directions":"Beat the cream and 1/2 teaspoon of vanilla extract together with an electric mixer, gradually adding confectioners' sugar, until the whipped cream forms fluffy peaks. Cover the blueberry pie filling with the whipped cream, and refrigerate until served."}]

recipe_card: Frozen Lemon Pavlova 4 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"2 teaspoons cornstarch"},{"recipe_ingredients":"6  egg whites"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 ½ cups white sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 ½ teaspoons ground cinnamon"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup white sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 ½ ounces sliced almonds"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3  egg whites"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 pinch salt"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup white sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup lemon juice"},{"recipe_ingredients":"4 teaspoons lemon zest"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup heavy cream"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1  lemon, sliced"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 sprig fresh mint"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup fresh strawberries"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Preheat an oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 10x15 jelly roll pan and line the pan with parchment. Grease the parchment and dust with the cornstarch."},{"recipe_directions":"Beat the 6 egg whites until foamy in a large glass or metal mixing bowl. Gradually add 1 1/2 cups sugar, continuing to beat until stiff peaks form. Lift your beater or whisk straight up: the egg whites should form a sharp peak that holds its shape. Spread the meringue mixture in the prepared pan."},{"recipe_directions":"Whisk together the cinnamon and 1/4 cup sugar in a small bowl. Sprinkle cinnamon sugar, then almonds, evenly over the meringue mixture."},{"recipe_directions":"Bake meringue in the preheated oven until lightly brown, 12 to 15 minutes. Remove pan from oven; turn over onto a foil-covered surface, almond side down. Set aside to cool completely. Carefully remove parchment when cool."},{"recipe_directions":"Beat the 3 egg whites until foamy in a large glass or metal mixing bowl. Add salt, continuing to beat until stiff peaks form. Gradually beat in 1 cup sugar; then gradually beat in lemon juice and zest."},{"recipe_directions":"In a separate bowl, beat cream until stiff peaks form. Fold whipped cream into lemon mixture."},{"recipe_directions":"Place the filling in the center of the meringue. Using the foil to lift the meringue, fold the sides of the meringue over the filling, making a log shape. Wrap the log in foil and place in freezer for at least two hours."},{"recipe_directions":"To serve, unwrap pavlova. Decorate with lemon slices, mint leaves and strawberries. Serve frozen."}]

recipe_card: A Drama Queen's Pavlova 32 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"6  egg whites"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 pinch salt"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 ½ teaspoons vinegar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 cups castor sugar or superfine sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 ½ teaspoons vanilla extract"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ cup unsweetened flaked coconut (Optional)"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 cups sweetened whipped cream"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup fresh strawberries, sliced"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2  kiwifruit, peeled, halved lengthwise, and sliced"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1  fresh peach - peeled, pitted and sliced"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ cup fresh blueberries"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (220 degrees C). You will be turning the temperature down to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C) when you put this in to bake. Line a 9 or 10 inch round glass dish with parchment paper."},{"recipe_directions":"Combine the egg whites and salt in a large bowl. Beat with an electric mixer, or stand mixer using a whisk attachment until able to form soft peaks. Sprinkle in the sugar 1 tablespoon at a time while continuing to whip to stiff peaks. Stir in the vanilla and vinegar, and fold in coconut if using. Spread evenly into the prepared glass dish, making sure to spread out to all of the edges."},{"recipe_directions":"Place the Pavlova into the oven, and immediately reduce the temperature to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C). Bake for 40 to 50 minutes, or until the top is crisp and a pale straw color. Leave in the oven, and turn off the heat. Let it stay in the oven until the oven has cooled completely."},{"recipe_directions":"Once the Pavlova is cooled, top generously with sweetened whipped cream. Arrange the strawberries, kiwis, peaches and blueberries in beautiful concentric circles on top."}]

recipe_card: Pavlova Deluxe 39 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"6  egg whites"},{"recipe_ingredients":"⅛ teaspoon cream of tartar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup white sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon cornstarch"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 teaspoons distilled white vinegar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 ¼ cups heavy cream, chilled"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon vanilla extract"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 teaspoons confectioners' sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"4  passion fruits"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (205 degrees C). Grease interior of 8 inch springform pan and dust lightly with cornstarch."},{"recipe_directions":"Beat egg whites, preferably in a glass or ceramic bowl, until stiff and glossy. Make sure egg whites have absolutely no contact with grease (fresh or residual), or even a speck of yolk. Combine cream of tartar, white sugar, and cornstarch; gradually beat in to the egg whites. Sprinkle vinegar over egg white mixture, then fold it in very gently."},{"recipe_directions":"Pile meringue into prepared pan. Spread to the sides leaving a slight depression in the center. Place in preheated oven. Close the oven door, and immediately turn oven down to 250 degrees F (120 degrees C). Bake for 75 to 90 minutes. Open oven door, but leave meringue in the oven for 15 more minutes. Remove meringue to a draft free spot. Very carefully remove rim of springform pan, and allow meringue to cool completely. There may be a slight sinking in the center. Carefully remove meringue from pan base, and place on serving platter."},{"recipe_directions":"Whip cream, vanilla extract, and confectioners' sugar until thick and firm. Gently spread over the meringue."},{"recipe_directions":"Remove the pulp from the passion fruit, and spoon over cream. If using kiwi, peel and slice the fruit; arrange slightly overlapping slices in a pleasing design. Chill until serving time."}]

recipe_card: Orange-Berry Pavlova
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"6  egg whites, room temperature"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon cream of tartar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 pinch salt"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup white sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon vanilla extract"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon almond extract"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 ½ tablespoons cornstarch"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 cups heavy whipping cream"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 large orange, zested"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon vanilla extract"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 large orange, peeled and sliced"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¾ cup mixed fresh berries"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Preheat the oven to 250 degrees F (120 degrees C). Draw a 9-inch circle on a large sheet of parchment paper. Place parchment on a large baking sheet with the circle facing down and centered in the pan."},{"recipe_directions":"Beat together egg whites, cream of tartar, and salt on high speed with an electric mixer in a bowl until soft peaks form. Add in sugar 1 tablespoon at a time, beating continuously, until stiff, glossy peaks form. Mix in vanilla and almond extracts. Sift cornstarch over the egg mixture and gently fold in until just combined."},{"recipe_directions":"Pour egg mixture into the center of the circle on the parchment paper on the prepared pan. Starting from the center and moving outwards, gently form the meringue into a round no larger than the drawn circle. Create an impression in the center of the meringue so the edges are slightly taller than the middle."},{"recipe_directions":"Place into the preheated oven and bake until the pavlova feels firm and dry to the touch, 1 to 1 1/2 hours. Turn the oven off without removing pavlova. Leave in the oven to cool for at least 1 hour."},{"recipe_directions":"Pour heavy whipping cream into a large bowl. Beat at medium-high speed until soft peaks form. Add orange zest and vanilla extract; beat until combined."},{"recipe_directions":"Gently remove pavlova base from the parchment paper and place onto a serving tray. Top with whipped cream, oranges slices, and mixed berries. Serve immediately."}]

recipe_card: Strawberry Rhubarb Meringue Dessert 16 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"2 cups all-purpose flour"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons white sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup cold butter"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 cups white sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"⅓ cup all-purpose flour"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon salt"},{"recipe_ingredients":"6  egg yolks"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup heavy cream"},{"recipe_ingredients":"5 cups thinly sliced rhubarb"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 cups thinly sliced strawberries"},{"recipe_ingredients":"6  egg whites"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon cream of tartar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¾ cup white sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon vanilla extract"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13-inch baking dish. Whisk together 2 cups of flour and 2 tablespoons of sugar in a bowl; use a pastry cutter to cut the butter into the flour mixture until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Press the crust into the bottom and up the sides of the prepared baking dish."},{"recipe_directions":"Bake crust in the preheated oven until lightly browned, about 20 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Mix together 2 cups of sugar, 1/3 cup of flour, salt, egg yolks, and cream in a large bowl until well combined; stir in the rhubarb and strawberries. Pour the filling into the baked crust."},{"recipe_directions":"Return to oven, and bake until the filling is set, 50 to 60 more minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Meanwhile, place egg whites and cream of tartar in a large mixing bowl, and beat with an electric mixer on medium-high speed until the whites form soft peaks; gradually beat in 3/4 cup of sugar until the mixture forms glossy, stiff peaks; beat in the vanilla extract. Remove the dessert from the oven, and top with the meringue, swirling and lifting your spatula to make decorative peaks and swirls. Return to oven, and bake until the meringue is pale golden brown, about 15 more minutes. Cool the pie to room temperature, then chill to serve."}]

recipe_card: Mini Berry Pavlovas 2 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"4  egg whites"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup white sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon cornstarch"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon cream of tartar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon vanilla extract"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 pinch salt"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup whipped cream, or more to taste"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¾ cup sliced fresh berries, or more to taste"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Preheat the oven to 275 degrees F (135 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper."},{"recipe_directions":"Beat egg whites in a glass, metal, or ceramic bowl on medium speed with an electric mixer until until soft peaks form, about 3 minutes. Slowly add sugar, cornstarch, and cream of tartar and continue beating on high speed until stiff, glossy peaks form, 3 to 5 minutes. Add vanilla extract and salt and beat until combined, about 30 seconds."},{"recipe_directions":"Scoop the meringue with a spring-hinged scoop onto the prepared baking sheet and shape into individual rounds about 3 inches in diameter. Use the back of a spoon to create an indentation in the center of the meringue."},{"recipe_directions":"Bake in the preheated oven until the meringue is dry to the touch, about 1 hour 15 minutes. Transfer the parchment with the meringues on it to a wire rack and allow to cool. Once meringues are cool to the touch, remove from parchment and place directly on the rack to cool completely, about 1 hour."},{"recipe_directions":"When ready to serve, top each meringue with whipped cream and garnish with fresh berries."}]

recipe_card: Pavlova with Winter Fruits 1 Rating
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"4  egg whites, at room temperature"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¾ cup white sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup superfine sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 ½ teaspoons cornstarch"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon orange blossom water (Optional)"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon white vinegar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3  lemons, zested and juiced"},{"recipe_ingredients":"⅓ cup white sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"4 large egg yolks"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 pinch sea salt"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 tablespoons coconut oil, at room temperature"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup heavy cream"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons confectioners' sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon orange blossom water (Optional)"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1  pink grapefruit, peeled and sliced crosswise"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1  orange, peeled and sliced crosswise"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1  ripe Fuyu persimmon, peeled and thinly sliced"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½  pomegranate, seeded"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Preheat the oven to 250 degrees F (120 degrees C). Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper. Invert a small bowl onto the parchment paper and trace the rim with a pencil. Repeat twice more. Flip parchment paper over."},{"recipe_directions":"Beat egg whites in a large bowl with an electric mixer until soft peaks begin to form. Gradually add white sugar, with the mixer running. Whisk superfine sugar and cornstarch in a small bowl. Gradually beat into the meringue. Continue beating meringue until stiff, glossy peaks form. Beat in orange blossom water and vinegar."},{"recipe_directions":"Spoon meringue into the traced circles. Make the borders higher than the center, to leave room for the filling."},{"recipe_directions":"Bake meringues in the preheated oven until firm and dry to the touch, about 1 hour."},{"recipe_directions":"Meanwhile, make the lemon curd. Fill a medium saucepan with 1 inch of water and bring to a bare simmer."},{"recipe_directions":"Whisk lemon juice, lemon zest, sugar, egg yolks, and salt together in a glass bowl. Set the bowl over the simmering water. Cook, whisking constantly, until curd foams, then thickens, about 10 minutes. Remove the bowl from the simmering water. Gradually whisk in coconut oil until melted and incorporated."},{"recipe_directions":"Strain the curd through a fine-mesh sieve; discard solids left in the strainer. Press a sheet of plastic wrap directly onto the surface to prevent a skin from forming. Transfer to the refrigerator."},{"recipe_directions":"Turn off oven and keep meringues inside until completely dry, about 1 hour."},{"recipe_directions":"Combine heavy cream, confectioners' sugar, and orange blossom water in a bowl. Beat with an electric mixer until soft peaks form."},{"recipe_directions":"Spoon lemon curd into the center of the cooled meringues. Mound whipped cream over the curd. Arrange grapefruit, orange, and persimmon slices on top. Sprinkle pomegranate seeds over the top."}]

recipe_card: Meringue Cake with Whipped Cream and Raspberries 12 Ratings
recipe_name: Meringue Cake with Whipped Cream and Raspberries
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup confectioners' sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ cup granulated sugar, plus"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon granulated sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon cornstarch"},{"recipe_ingredients":"4  large egg whites, at room temperature"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon cream of tartar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 cups heavy cream"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon vanilla extract"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 pint fresh raspberries"},{"recipe_ingredients":"NOTE: You will need parchment paper for this recipe."}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"The night before serving, adjust oven rack to lower-middle position and heat oven to 500 degrees."},{"recipe_directions":"Line a lipped cookie sheet (approximately 12 by 18 inches) with parchment paper. Trace two side-by-side rectangles - about 5 inches by 12 or 13 inches - on the paper. Crumple the paper, then smooth it out again and line the bottom of the pan."},{"recipe_directions":"Whisk together confectioner's sugar, 1/2 cup granulated sugar and cornstarch. Set aside."},{"recipe_directions":"In the bowl of a mixer, beat egg whites and cream of tartar until they turn from foamy to white and beaters just start to leave a trail. On low speed, add sugar mixture, a heaping tablespoon at a time. Increase speed to medium-high and beat to the consistency of marshmallow cream, 2 to 3 minutes longer."},{"recipe_directions":"Just before forming meringues, flick water onto parchment with fingertips. Divide meringue in half, spooning two or three mounds down each traced rectangle. Use a rubber spatula, or a cake decorator's metal offset spatula, to fill in and even out rectangles."},{"recipe_directions":"Set meringues in oven, close door and turn oven off (but leave oven light on). Let meringues dry overnight. Remove, then carefully set a wire rack or cookie sheet over meringues. Invert; peel off parchment and turn right side up. (It's OK if edges chip.) Wrap in foil and set aside until ready to proceed."},{"recipe_directions":"No more than two hours before serving, whip cream to soft peaks, beating in remaining sugar and the vanilla. Set one meringue on a platter. Spread with half the cream and sprinkle on half the berries. Repeat with remaining meringue, cream and berries. Refrigerate, uncovered, until ready to serve."}]

recipe_card: Chocolate Pavlova 27 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"6  egg whites"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ teaspoon salt"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ teaspoon cream of tartar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 ½ cups granulated sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 tablespoons unsweetened cocoa powder"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 teaspoons cornstarch"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon vinegar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 teaspoons vanilla extract"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 (1 ounce) squares bittersweet chocolate, melted"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 cups fresh strawberries, hulled and halved"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 ½ cups whipping cream"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 teaspoons granulated sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 (1 ounce) square bittersweet chocolate, melted"}]

Gently fold in vinegar, vanilla, and melted chocolate."},{"recipe_directions":"Line a baking sheet with parchment paper, and spread the meringue into an eight inch circle. Allow to cool completely, about one hour."},{"recipe_directions":"Whip cream with the sugar, and spread over the meringue. recipe_card: Lemon Blueberry Pavlova 9 Ratings

recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Prepare lemon curd filling: Cut butter into small pieces and set aside."},{"recipe_directions":"Separate eggs, placing yolks in a heat-proof bowl and whites in glass, metal, or ceramic bowl. Brush some onto lattice, but make sure it doesn't run off the sides."},{"recipe_directions":"Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce the temperature to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) and continue baking until apples are soft, 35 to 45 minutes."}]

recipe_card: Rhubarb Galette 1 Rating
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"1 ⅓ cups all-purpose flour, plus more for dusting"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 teaspoons white sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon kosher salt"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ cup cold unsalted butter, cubed"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup ice cold water"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 ¼ pounds fresh rhubarb"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ cup white sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon cornstarch"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon vanilla extract"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon ground cardamom"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon grated orange zest"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 large egg"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon water"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 teaspoons turbinado sugar"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Gather all ingredients."},{"recipe_directions":"Dotdash Meredith Food Studios"},{"recipe_directions":"Prepare the Crust: Whisk together flour, white sugar, and salt in a large bowl."},{"recipe_directions":"Dotdash Meredith Food Studios"},{"recipe_directions":"Add butter; using your fingers or a pastry blender, work the butter into the flour mixture until butter pieces are no larger than a dime."},{"recipe_directions":"Dotdash Meredith Food Studios"},{"recipe_directions":"Drizzle ice cold water over the flour and butter mixture. Gently combine until no dry spots remain and the mixture resembles a shaggy dough."},{"recipe_directions":"Dotdash Meredith Food Studios"},{"recipe_directions":"Form the dough into a rectangular block and wrap in plastic wrap. Refrigerate until firm, at least 1 hour."},{"recipe_directions":"Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Place a rimmed baking sheet on the center rack of oven. Line a second baking sheet with parchment paper."},{"recipe_directions":"Lightly dust a work surface with flour. Roll the dough into a large rectangle, about 12x16 inches, constantly turning and moving the dough to prevent sticking. Transfer the rolled dough to the lined baking sheet and chill for 15 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Dotdash Meredith Food Studios"},{"recipe_directions":"Prepare the Filling: Halve rhubarb stalks lengthwise and cut into 8-inch pieces. Combine rhubarb pieces, white sugar, cornstarch, vanilla, cardamom, and orange zest in a large bowl; mix well. Let stand 5 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Dotdash Meredith Food Studios"},{"recipe_directions":"Remove the dough from the fridge refrigerator. Place the rhubarb side-by-side in an even layer in the center of the dough, leaving a 2-inch border around the edges. Fold the edges towards the center of the galette (the edges will overlap with some of the filling). Pinch pleats corners firmly to seal."},{"recipe_directions":"Dotdash Meredith Food Studios"},{"recipe_directions":"Whisk together the egg and tap water in a small bowl. Brush the dough with the egg wash and sprinkle with turbinado sugar. Refrigerate for 15 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Remove baking sheet from oven; carefully slide the galette and parchment paper onto the preheated baking sheet in the oven."},{"recipe_directions":"Bake in the preheated oven until the crust is golden and the rhubarb is softened, 30 to 40 minutes. Remove from the oven and let cool on the baking sheet for 5 minutes, then transfer to a cooling rack to cool for 15 minutes before serving. Serve warm with ice cream, if desired."}]

recipe_card: These Homemade Cherry Tarts Are Sure to Sweeten Your Day
recipe_name: These Homemade Cherry Tarts Are Sure to Sweeten Your Day
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"1 (14.1 ounce) package refrigerated pie crusts"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 pound fresh sweet cherries, pitted"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons minute tapioca"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1/3 cup sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1/2 teaspoon almond extract"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 pinch salt"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1/2 cup whipped cream, or as needed (optional)"},{"recipe_ingredients":"grated chocolate as needed for garnish (optional)"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Place pie crusts on a lightly floured surface and roll out each crust with a rolling pin, so it is large enough to cut three 5 to 5-1/2-inch circles, for a total of 6 tart crusts."},{"recipe_directions":"Fit each dough circle into a 4-inch removable-bottom tart pan. Press the dough against the sides of the pans, and prick the bottom with a fork to prevent bubbling. Remove any excess dough by running the rolling pin across the top of each pan."},{"recipe_directions":"Refrigerate tart crusts until well chilled, about 45 minutes, keeping them refrigerated until ready to use."},{"recipe_directions":"Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)."},{"recipe_directions":"In a large bowl, combine cherries, tapioca, sugar, almond extract, and salt. Remove the pans from the fridge and distribute cherry mixture evenly among the tart pans. Place the pans on a baking sheet."},{"recipe_directions":"Bake in the preheated oven until cherries are soft and crust is golden brown, 25 to 30 minutes."}]

recipe_card: Pear Galette with Ginger 1 Rating
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"1 refrigerated pie crust"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon all-purpose flour, divided"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 or 4 red pears, cored and thinly sliced"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon lemon juice"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1/4 cup light brown sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon cornstarch"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1/4 teaspoon ground ginger"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 pinch salt"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons unsalted butter, cut into small pieces"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 large egg, beaten"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons pear or lemon curd"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons bourbon (optional)"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 teaspoons minced candied ginger, or to taste"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Line a sheet pan with parchment paper. Sprinkle about 1/2 tablespoon flour in the center of the pan."},{"recipe_directions":"Following manufacturer’s instructions, bring refrigerated pie crust to room temperature."},{"recipe_directions":"In a medium mixing bowl, toss pear slices with lemon juice. In a small bowl, combine brown sugar, cornstarch, ground ginger, and salt. Sprinkle dry ingredients over pear slices and toss to coat."},{"recipe_directions":"Unroll pie crust and place in the center of the prepared pan. Sprinkle remaining flour over crust, and roll into a 12-inch circle."},{"recipe_directions":"Beginning 2 inches from the edge of the pie crust, arrange pears on the dough in a pleasing design all the way around. Stack any extra slices in the center. Dot with butter, and drizzle any remaining juices in the bowl over the sliced pears."},{"recipe_directions":"Fold the edges of the crust over pears, making a pleat every few inches, as necessary. If the pleats don’t want to hold, lightly moisten with wet fingertips. Lightly brush crust with beaten egg."},{"recipe_directions":"Bake in the center of the preheated oven until crust is brown and pears are bubbly, 35 to 40 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Remove galette from the oven. Stir pear or lemon curd together with bourbon in a microwave-safe bowl. Microwave on High until mixture bubbles, about 1 minute. Brush mixture over pear filling. Sprinkle candied ginger over all."},{"recipe_directions":"Using the parchment paper, slide the galette onto a cooling rack and allow to cool completely."},{"recipe_directions":"When ready to serve, use parchment paper to transfer to a serving dish or cutting board, then hold the galette in place and slide the parchment paper out. Cut into 8 wedges and serve."},{"recipe_directions":"If you prefer to make your own crust, use a recipe for a single pie crust, such as this Butter Flaky Pie Crust."},{"recipe_directions":""},{"recipe_directions":"If you prefer not to include the bourbon, use 1 tablespoon of water or lemon juice, instead."}]

recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)."},{"recipe_directions":"Make crumble: Combine flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt in a large bowl. recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"6 cups peeled, sliced fresh peaches"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1/4 cup brown sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 tablespoons flour"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon lemon juice"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon lemon zest"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup flour"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon baking powder"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1/4 teaspoon salt"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 large egg"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1/2 cup butter, melted"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Lightly grease a 2-1/2 quart baking dish."},{"recipe_directions":"Place peaches in the prepared baking dish. Combine brown sugar, 3 tablespoons flour, lemon juice, lemon zest, and cinnamon; sprinkle over peaches."},{"recipe_directions":"Combine 1 cup flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, and nutmeg. Stir in egg and mix until mixture has pea-sized crumbles. Sprinkle mixture over peaches. Pour butter evenly over crumbles."},{"recipe_directions":"Bake in the preheated oven until the top is lightly browned, 37 to 40 minutes."}]

Beat eggs, 1 at a time, into butter mixture until incorporated; fold in pears. Pour filling into chilled crust."},{"recipe_directions":"Bake in the preheated oven until filling is set in the middle, 30 to 35 minutes. Cool completely before serving, about 1 hour."}]

recipe_card: Pear Preserves Cake 8 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup butter, softened"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 cups white sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"5  egg yolks"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup buttermilk"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon baking soda"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 ½ cups all-purpose flour"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon ground cinnamon"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon ground allspice"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon ground nutmeg"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup chopped pecans"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ cup all-purpose flour"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup pear preserves"},{"recipe_ingredients":"5  egg whites"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 cups white sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 ½ cups milk"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 ½ cups white sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¾ cup butter, softened"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour 3 (9 inch) pans. Sift together 2 1/2 cups flour, cinnamon, allspice and nutmeg; set aside. Toss pecans in 1/2 cup flour; set aside."},{"recipe_directions":"In a large bowl, cream together 1 cup butter and 2 cups sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in the yolks one at a time. Dissolve baking soda in buttermilk. Beat in the flour mixture alternately with the buttermilk. Fold in the pecan mixture and the pear preserves."},{"recipe_directions":"In a large glass or metal mixing bowl, beat egg whites until stiff peaks form. Fold 1/3 of the whites into the batter, then quickly fold in remaining whites until no streaks remain. Pour batter into prepared pan."},{"recipe_directions":"Bake in the preheated oven for 35 to 40 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean. Let cool in pan for 10 minutes, then turn out onto a wire rack and cool completely."},{"recipe_directions":"Make Frosting: In a large saucepan, combine 3 cups sugar and milk. Cook over low heat, stirring frequently, until sugar is dissolved. Remove from heat and set aside. Place remaining 1 1/2 cup sugar in a cast iron skillet, cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until sugar dissolves and becomes a golden syrup. Remove from heat and carefully stir in butter. Gradually pour syrup mixture into milk mixture in saucepan. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the mixture reaches soft ball stage (240 degrees F/ 115 degrees C). Remove from heat and beat at medium speed of electric mixture for about 5 minutes or until thick enough to spread. Spread immediately on cooled cake."}]

Turn the pears a few times as they cool so the color remains even."}]

recipe_card: Instant Pot® Butternut Squash and Pear Soup 15 Ratings

recipe_name: Instant Pot® Butternut Squash and Pear Soup
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"1 (3 pound) butternut squash"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup water"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon olive oil"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ medium onion, quartered"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 cloves garlic, peeled"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2  ripe pears - peeled, cored, and chopped into 1-inch chunks"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 ½ teaspoons salt"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¾ teaspoon ground sage"},{"recipe_ingredients":"4 cups chicken broth"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ cup heavy cream"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Cut butternut squash into 4 pieces and remove seeds. Pour water into the bottom of a multi-functional electric pressure cooker and place trivet inside. Place squash on trivet, close lid, and set seal valve. Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 10 minutes. Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build."},{"recipe_directions":"Release pressure carefully using the quick-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 5 minutes. Unlock and remove the lid. Drain out the water and wipe the bottom of the pot dry. Remove squash skin and discard. Roughly chop any large pieces into smaller 1- to 2-inch chunks. Set aside."},{"recipe_directions":"Select the Saute function and heat olive oil. Saute onion and garlic for 1 to 2 minutes. Add pears, salt, and sage; cook for 1 to 2 minutes more. Turn pressure cooker off. Add the squash and chicken broth. Close lid and seal valve. Select high pressure; set timer for 5 minutes. Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build."},{"recipe_directions":"Release pressure manually and remove lid. Blend soup until smooth using an immersion blender. Stir in heavy cream."}]

recipe_card: Charred Spiced Pears with Smoky Vanilla-Cherry Sauce
recipe_name: Charred Spiced Pears with Smoky Vanilla-Cherry Sauce
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"1 vanilla bean"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1/2 cup brandy"},{"recipe_ingredients":"10 ounces frozen tart red cherries, thawed"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1/2 cup packed brown sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3/4 teaspoon ground ginger"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1/4 teaspoon ground allspice"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1/8 teaspoon salt"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon water"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 teaspoons cornstarch"},{"recipe_ingredients":"4 ripe pears, halved lengthwise and cored"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Put vanilla bean on a foil-lined baking sheet set on a wire rack. Toast vanilla bean with a kitchen torch, turning occasionally, until lightly charred and starting to smoke, about 30 seconds. Let cool 5 minutes. Split vanilla bean lengthwise."},{"recipe_directions":"Combine split vanilla bean and brandy in a medium saucepan. Carefully bring to a simmer over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to medium; cook, stirring occasionally, until brandy is reduced to 2 tablespoons, 7 to 8 minutes. Meanwhile, blend cherries in a blender or food processor until smooth."},{"recipe_directions":"Stir together brown sugar, ginger, allspice, and pepper in a shallow bowl. For sauce, add 3 tablespoons brown sugar mixture, the puréed cherries, and salt to brandy mixture in saucepan. Return to a boil; reduce heat to medium and simmer, stirring occasionally, until sugar is dissolved, about 3 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Remove vanilla bean from sauce; scrape out seeds. Stir seeds into sauce, then strain through a fine-mesh sieve. Return sauce to saucepan."},{"recipe_directions":"Whisk together water and cornstarch. Add to sauce. Bring to a boil over medium heat; reduce heat to medium-low. Cook, stirring constantly, until thickened, about 2 minutes. Remove from heat."},{"recipe_directions":"Dip cut sides of pears in remaining brown sugar mixture to coat evenly. Arrange pears, cut sides up, on prepared baking sheet. Brown sugared surface of pears with a kitchen torch, about 5 minutes for entire recipe. Serve pears with sauce. (Chill sauce in an airtight container up to 5 days.)"},{"recipe_directions":"When using a torch, set a foil-lined pan on a wire rack to protect your work surface from the heat."}]

recipe_card: Rustic Autumn Fruit Tart 88 Ratings

When you squeeze a handful of the mixture, it should form a ball. Shape the dough into a round disk, wrap it in plastic, and refrigerate for at least 1 hour."},{"recipe_directions":"Toss the sliced apples and pear with the orange juice. Toss the fruit with the sugar-spice mixture and set aside."},{"recipe_directions":"Preheat an oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). If you're baking the tart on a baking sheet, leave a 2-inch rim of dough and fold it up over the edge of the fruit (the pastry folds will overlap)."},{"recipe_directions":"Bake the tart in the preheated oven until the crust is browned and the filling is bubbly, about 30 minutes. recipe_card: Apple and Pear Soup 13 Ratings
recipe_tags: [{"recipe_tags":"Soups, Stews and Chili Recipes"},{"recipe_tags":"Soup Recipes"},{"recipe_tags":"Vegetable Soup Recipes"}]
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon reduced-fat margarine"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3  tart apples - peeled, cored, and chopped"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3  pears - peeled, cored, and chopped"},{"recipe_ingredients":"5 cups vegetable broth"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon rubbed sage"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ teaspoon ground black pepper"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1  bay leaf"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 ½ teaspoons pureed fresh ginger"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon chopped fresh parsley"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Melt the margarine in a large saucepan over medium heat. Cook and stir the apples and pears in the melted margarine for about 5 minutes. Add the vegetable broth, sage, pepper, and bay leaf to the pan; bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Place a cover on the saucepan and allow the mixture to simmer until hot and the apples and pears are tender, about 20 minutes. Remove from heat and allow to cool for 5 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Pour about 1/3 of the soup into a blender, filling the pitcher no more than halfway full. Hold the lid of the blender in place with a towel and carefully start the blender, using a few quick pulses to get the soup moving before leaving it on to puree. Puree in batches until smooth; pour into a clean pot. Alternately, you can use a stick blender and puree the soup right in the saucepan. Return the pureed soup to the saucepan and warm over medium heat until completely reheated. Garnish with parsley to serve."}]

recipe_card: Poached Pears Belle Helene 14 Ratings

Add the seeds and split pods to the poaching liquid. Pour in sugar."},{"recipe_directions":"Bring pot to a simmer over medium-high heat; stir gently to dissolve sugar with minimal jostling of the pears. Reduce heat so pears continue cooking over a steady, gentle simmer. Pears need to stay submerged, so place a small plate over them in the pot to keep them under the liquid. Simmer until pears are just tender, 20 to 25 minutes. (Remove plate to test the pears for doneness.) Remove pot from heat and let pears cool to room temperature in the poaching liquid."},{"recipe_directions":"Transfer pears and vanilla beans to a storage container and cover with some of the poaching liquid. Cover and refrigerate until pears are thoroughly chilled, several hours or overnight. Reserve all of the poaching liquid (see footnote)."},{"recipe_directions":"Heat hot fudge sauce in a saucepan over medium heat until warm. Dip base of pear into the chocolate and spoon chocolate along the sides except for the top inch or so of the pear."},{"recipe_directions":"Place dipped pears in individual serving bowls with another generous spoonful of syrup and a small scoop of vanilla ice cream."}]

recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Cut 4 ounce block of cream cheese in half, then in half again to create 4 pieces. Further cut each piece in half again so you have 8 equal pieces total. Set aside."},{"recipe_directions":"Working with 6 wonton wrappers at a time, separate them out onto a clean work surface. Divide one of the cream cheese pieces into 6 pieces and place a piece in the middle of each wonton wrapper. Place 1 teaspoon of blueberry pie filling over the top of the cream cheese. Do not overfill, as the mixture may ooze out."},{"recipe_directions":"Use your finger to lightly wet the 4 edges of each wonton wrapper. Gently fold in half diagonally to make a triangle, then bring up the remaining two corners so all corners join together. Try not to leave excess air in the wonton, which can cause them to burst. Press seams together to ensure a tight seal. Set wontons aside, covered in a damp paper towel, while you finish making the remaining wontons."},{"recipe_directions":"Preheat the air fryer to 325 degrees F (160 degrees C). Spray the inner basket with cooking spray and place as many wontons in basket as will fit, without overcrowding. Lightly mist wontons with cooking spray."},{"recipe_directions":"Air-fry for 5 minutes. Remove to a cooling rack and dust with powdered sugar. Let cool while you cook the remaining wontons in batches. Best served slightly warm or at room temperature."}]

Remove saucepan from heat and stir butter, rum, and vanilla extract into pudding; fold in pineapple."}]

recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"cooking spray"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 cups all-purpose flour"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 teaspoons baking soda"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 teaspoons ground cinnamon"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon salt"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2  eggs"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 ½ cups white sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¾ cup buttermilk"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¾ cup unsweetened applesauce"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons vegetable oil"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 teaspoons vanilla extract"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 ½ cups grated carrots"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 ½ cups chopped pecans"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 (8 ounce) can crushed pineapple in juice, drained and juice reserved"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 (8 ounce) package Neufchatel cheese, softened"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon reserved pineapple juice"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 (16 ounce) package confectioners' sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon vanilla extract"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 pinch salt"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Spray a 9x13-inch baking dish with cooking spray."},{"recipe_directions":"Sift flour, baking soda, cinnamon, and 1/2 teaspoon salt together in a bowl. Lightly beat eggs in a bowl; add white sugar, buttermilk, applesauce, oil, and 2 teaspoons vanilla extract and mix well. Stir buttermilk mixture, carrots, pecans, and drained pineapple into flour mixture just until mixed; pour into prepared dish."},{"recipe_directions":"Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted in the center of the cake comes out clean, 45 to 50 minutes. Cool cake in baking dish on a wire rack, about 1 hour. Cover dish tightly with plastic wrap; refrigerate 8 hours to overnight."},{"recipe_directions":"Beat Neufchatel cheese and 1 tablespoon reserved pineapple juice together in a bowl with an electric mixer until smooth; add confectioners' sugar, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, and 1 pinch salt and beat until frosting is smooth. Spread frosting on cake."}]

recipe_card: Carrot Cake Roll 3 Ratings

Add carrot and pineapple."},{"recipe_directions":"Mix flour, cinnamon, baking powder, and salt together in a separate bowl. Pour in egg mixture; mix until it comes together. Spread batter on the prepared baking sheet."},{"recipe_directions":"Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Allow to cool completely, about 30 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Beat cream cheese, powdered sugar, and vanilla extract together in a bowl. Spread cream cheese filling evenly over the cooled cake. Sprinkle walnuts on top of filling."},{"recipe_directions":"Run a spatula under the cake to loosen from the parchment paper. Grab the paper from one end and start rolling, pulling the paper away as you do. Roll up and refrigerate for 1 hour before cutting."}]

recipe_card: Traditional Mince Pies 28 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"1 3/4 cups all-purpose flour"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1/2 cup confectioners' sugar, divided"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 teaspoons ground cinnamon"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2/3 cup butter, softened"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons grated orange zest"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1/4 cup ice water"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3/4 cup prepared mincemeat pie filling"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 large egg, beaten"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)."},{"recipe_directions":"Sift together flour, 1/4 cup confectioners' sugar, and cinnamon. Use a pastry cutter or two forks to mix in butter until mixture resembles fine bread crumbs. Stir in orange zest. Sprinkle with ice water and gather dough into a ball. Roll out on a lightly floured surface to 1/4 inch thick. Cut out approximately 18 (3-inch) diameter circles, and 18 (2-inch) circles, re-rolling dough as needed."},{"recipe_directions":"Line muffin cups or mini tart tins using the 3-inch pastry circles. Fill each pastry cup with about 1 tablespoon of mincemeat filling. Top with 2-inch pastry circles, pinching circles together to seal the edges. Brush the top of each pie with egg."},{"recipe_directions":"Bake pies in preheated oven until tops are golden brown, 15 to 20 minutes. Cool slightly on wire racks. Dust with remaining 1/4 cup confectioners' sugar just before serving."}]

recipe_card: Mini Christmas Cakes
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"3 cups dried currants"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 ¼ cups raisins"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup sultana raisins"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ cup candied red cherries, chopped"},{"recipe_ingredients":"8 fluid ounces brandy"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 large orange, zested"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 large lemon, zested"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup unsalted butter, softened"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons unsalted butter, softened"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup brown sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons brown sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 large eggs, beaten"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon molasses, or more to taste"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup chopped almonds"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup all-purpose flour"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ cup self-rising flour"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ cup ground almonds"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 teaspoons mixed spice"},{"recipe_ingredients":"6 tablespoons apricot jam"},{"recipe_ingredients":"10 ounces marzipan"},{"recipe_ingredients":"12 ounces white fondant"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon blue food coloring"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Make the cakes: Combine currants, raisins, sultana raisins, and candied cherries in a plastic container with a lid. Pour brandy over dried fruit; stir in orange and lemon zest. Close the container and let soak, stirring or shaking every few hours, for 2 to 3 days."},{"recipe_directions":"Preheat the oven to 275 degrees F (135 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with 24 silicone cupcake liners or ramekins."},{"recipe_directions":"Combine 1 cup plus 2 tablespoons butter and 1 cup plus 2 tablespoons brown sugar in a bowl; beat with an electric mixer until well combined. Mix in eggs and molasses until well combined. Stir in chopped almonds, both flours, and mixed spice until well combined. Fold in ground almonds and soaked fruit. Spoon mixture into the prepared liners."},{"recipe_directions":"Bake in the center of the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean, about 1 1/2 hours. Remove from the oven and let cool to room temperature, 30 to 45 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Transfer cakes to airtight tins and let sit for at least 10 days before decorating."},{"recipe_directions":"When ready to decorate, heat jam in the microwave until soft and warm. Brush onto each cake."},{"recipe_directions":"Roll out marzipan between two sheets of plastic wrap. Cut out 24 circles the same diameter as the top of each cake; place one on top of each cake. Return to the airtight containers and let sit for 8 hours before continuing."},{"recipe_directions":"Roll out fondant between two sheets of plastic wrap. Cut out 24 circles the same diameter as the top of each cake. Place a cookie stencil on top of each circle, and paint in the stencil using a small brush and the food coloring. Place fondant circles on top of each cake."}]

recipe_card: Blood Orange Tart 4 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup all-purpose flour"},{"recipe_ingredients":"⅓ cup white sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon vanilla extract"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon salt"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ cup cold unsalted butter, cut into 1/2-inch pieces"},{"recipe_ingredients":"⅔ cup sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons cornstarch"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ teaspoon salt"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup blood orange juice"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 large eggs, lightly beaten"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 large egg yolk, lightly beaten"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons blood orange zest"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons unsalted butter, cut into 1/2-inch pieces"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 medium blood orange, thinly sliced"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Lightly grease a 9-inch tart pan with a removable bottom."},{"recipe_directions":"Make the crust: Pulse flour, sugar, vanilla, and salt in a food processor a few times to combine. Add cold butter and pulse several more times until mixture is very crumbly and resembles coarse sand."},{"recipe_directions":"Pour mixture into the prepared tart pan; use damp hands to press crumbs together evenly along the bottom and up the sides of the pan to form a crust. Gently prick the bottom of the crust several times with a fork. Freeze crust for 15 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Meanwhile, preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)."},{"recipe_directions":"Remove crust from the freezer and place it onto a baking sheet. Line the crust with aluminum foil and fill with dried beans."},{"recipe_directions":"Bake in the preheated oven until crust begins to turn golden brown, 20 to 25 minutes. Remove beans and aluminum foil; continue to bake until the center is set, 5 to 7 minutes more. Remove from the oven and reduce the heat to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C)."},{"recipe_directions":"Make the filling: Bring a pot of water to a low simmer."},{"recipe_directions":"While the water is coming to a simmer, whisk sugar, cornstarch, and salt together in a large heat-proof bowl. Whisk in orange juice, eggs, egg yolk, and orange zest until smooth."},{"recipe_directions":"Place the bowl over the pot of simmering water, making sure it does not touch the water. Cook, stirring constantly, until mixture is thick enough to coat the back of a spoon, 5 to 10 minutes. Remove from the heat and stir in butter, one piece at a time, ensuring each piece melts before adding the next. Pour filling through a fine-mesh sieve into the prepared crust."},{"recipe_directions":"Bake in the preheated oven until custard is set, 15 to 20 minutes. Allow tart to cool to room temperature before removing from pan, about 30 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Chill tart for about 3 hours. Top with blood orange slices before serving."}]

recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (205 degrees C). Line pastry with aluminum foil and a layer of pie weights or dried beans. Carefully remove the foil and weights; bake about 5 minutes more."},{"recipe_directions":"In a small saucepan, stir together the 3/4 cup sugar, 1/3 cup cornstarch, and salt. Mix in the orange juice, lemon juice, and water. Whisk in the egg yolks. Cook over medium heat, stirring frequently, until thick and bubbly, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat, and stir in butter and orange zest. If desired; stir in diced orange segments. Pour into prepared pie crust, cover with plastic wrap, and set aside to cool."},{"recipe_directions":"When pie filling has cooled to room temperature, preheat oven and prepare meringue. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). In a large glass or metal bowl, beat egg whites until foamy. Gradually add 1/2 cup sugar and cream of tartar, continuing to beat until stiff peaks form. Lift your beater or whisk straight up: the egg whites should form a sharp peak that holds its shape. Spread over pie, making sure the meringue completely covers the filling and meets the edges of the pie crust."},{"recipe_directions":"Bake in preheated oven until meringue topping is golden brown, about 15 minutes."}]

recipe_card: Fig Ice Cream 3 Ratings

Cover saucepan with a lid and refrigerate."},{"recipe_directions":"Heat half-and-half in a heavy saucepan over medium-high heat until hot but not boiling, 5 to 6 minutes. Remove saucepan from heat."},{"recipe_directions":"Whisk 1/2 cup sugar, egg yolks, and salt together in a bowl until smooth. Cover saucepan and chill custard completely, at least 3 hours."},{"recipe_directions":"Process custard in an ice cream maker according to manufacturer's instructions.
